From the manufacturer

AmazonBasics 2-Slice Toaster

Make crispy delicious toast with the AmazonBasics 2-Slice Toaster. The sleek small unit provides reliable results, toasting one or two slices of bread at a time. A useful addition to any kitchen counter, the two-slice toaster features a sleek black appearance for attractive everyday style.

6 Shade Settings

Easily accommodate individual preferences—a simple turn of the dial adjusts the shade setting. Choose lower settings for lighter toast or higher settings for darker, crispier toast. Indicator lights make it easy to see the selected setting at a glance.

Details

  • Toasts 1 or 2 slices at a time
  • 6 shade settings
  • Extra-wide slots
  • Bagel setting toasts the inside and warms the outside
  • Frozen setting for defrosting bread
  • Cancel function ends the session at any time
  • Extra-lift lever for safely removing smaller pieces
  • Cord wrap
  • Removable crumb tray
  • Indicator lights
  • Backed by an AmazonBasics limited 1-year warranty
Read more
View larger

Extra-Wide Slots

Toast bagels, thick slices of homemade bread, English muffins, and more thanks to the toaster’s extra-wide slots. Each slot measures 5-1/4 inches long by 1-1/4 inches wide.

Read more
View larger

Bagel, Frozen, and Cancel Functions

Choose the Bagel setting to toast just the cut side of your bagel or the Frozen setting to defrost bread.

Read more
View larger

Extra-Lift Function

No more burning fingertips when removing smaller pieces of toast. The toaster’s extra-lift lever raises toast up to help ensure safe retrieval.

Read more

Cord Wrap and Removable Crumb Tray

The toaster’s long 22-inch power cord (when routed out the back) makes it easy to situate the toaster right where you want it. When finished using the toaster, simply unplug it, and use the handy cord wrap for tidy out-of-the-way storage.

The AmazonBasics 2-Slice Toaster also comes with a removable crumb tray for quick, convenient cleanup as needed.

Read more

Marie Yelavich
5.0 out of 5 starsCheap, quiet toaster
June 11, 2018
Verified Purchase
I purchased this toaster to keep at my desk at work, which technically is not allowed. However, needing a better option than using the disgusting toaster in the break room that's never cleaned, I decided to test my luck. This little toaster is small, quiet, and toasts anything from English muffins to bagels quickly and evenly. After I'm done using it, I can easily move it out of sight since the sides remain cool, and toss it back in the drawer once it's completely cooled down. The bottom is also easy to slide out to remove crumbs, a feature unused with the break room toaster. Would highly recommend this product. Long live the contraband toaster.

Bryan
4.0 out of 5 starsRegarding smell
December 1, 2018
Verified Purchase
Some reviewers have complained about an offensive smell. I agree that upon initial testing it gave off an extremely strong and irritating smell. So I place in the garage and turned the heat selector to 6 and let it do it's thing without any food in it. Afterwards whatever caused the smell had burned off the offensive smell was gone. It was after this experience I decided to READ THE MANUAL and it plainly explains how to turn on the toaster for a few times without food in it to remove the smell. My only addition to manual would be to do this out of the house like in the garage as the odor is quite strong the first time you use it. I've learned my lesson: Always read the manual first!
Now it works just fine without the smell. We are quite happy with size and features.

Hannah Parker Canady
4.0 out of 5 starsDoes what it is supposed to, decent quality for the price
June 25, 2018
Verified Purchase
It feels kind of cheap, but at the same time it is cheap so I’m not complaining. It does a good job at toasting bread, haven’t tried bagels yet. The crumb tray is pretty handy, and overall I’m satisfied with my purchase.
To address the overheating issue: I checked and the sides do get a little hot, but this is with me using the toaster at higher settings than someone normally would because I like my toast a little burnt. When my husband uses it at a lower setting there is no issue with overheating. On top of that, no one really touches the sides of the toaster so to me it is not an issue whatsoever.

My girlfriend broke my decades old toaster trying to clean it. I bought this as a replacement. At first I thought someone forgot to put a toaster in the box, as it was too light. After that hassle, it makes good toast. However, today I got a bagel stuck in the down position. Pulling up on the lever pulls the whole toaster off the counter. So of course the instinct it to hold the toaster down, which results in severe burns to the fingers because someone (surprise!) didn't think to put an insulated top on the toaster...
